lines.text:
[chanting]
I'm not going to listen to this, I'm not going to hear this now.
Ray! Ray! You're chanting!

[points to book]
Ray. Ray, look.
Ray, unconscious chanting! You're chanting!
[continues chanting with fingers in ears]

[chants]
I want to kill everyone. Satan is good. Satan is our pal.
Ray. Ray, you're chanting! Hey, once they
[points to book]
get in here...
[points to Ray's head]
...it's over, pal.

Remember what you were saying about people in the 'burbs, Art, people like Skip, people who mow their lawn for the 800th time, and then SNAP? WELL, THAT'S US. IT'S NOT THEM, THAT'S US. WE'RE the ones who are vaulting over the fences, and peeking in through people's windows. We're the ones who are THROWING GARBAGE IN THE STREET, AND LIGHTING FIRES. WE'RE THE ONES WHO ARE ACTING SUSPICIOUS AND PARANOID, ART. WE'RE THE LUNATICS. US. IT'S NOT THEM. It's us.

[after a pause]
I don't know what to say... What, do you want me to move?
Klopek... what is that, Slavic?
NO.
'Bout a nine on the tension scale, Reub.
Ya know, did you ever see the movie, "The Sentinel", Mr. Peterson? It's about the old guy who owned the apartment, which is kind of like the, uh, gateway to Hell?
No, I... I didn't see that.
Oh, well, I was doing some thinking. And, you know, being that their last house burnt down and all, it's like, maybe... somebody left the gate open.
[a generator starts up from the Klopek's basement]
It's them. They're movin' around again. Ya know... it was a night just like this that it happened.
What happened, Mr. Weingartner?

Oh, it was a long time ago, Ricky. Hinkley Hills was a lot smaller then... safer too! You never had to lock your doors. Everybody knew everybody. I must have been maybe oh nine - ten years-old. You know where the big mall is?
Yeah.
Well, there used to be a big drugstore on the corner there, had a big soda fountain, remember?
Yeah.

Yeah, and the guy who ran it was a - was a rotund guy, had glasses. His name was Skip. Lived over on Elm, had a wife, a couple of kids, ya know? Not too sharp, I mean, hey the guy's 40 years old, he's wearing a paper hat and he's makin' cherry Cokes, it's a cinch he's not runnin' for governor, right?
[Ricky chuckles]

Anyway, it got hot that summer, I remember it got REAL hot. It was sweltering. Ya know that heat where your underwear sweats and it crawls up the... anyway, it's hot, okay? And they start... they start smellin' this... this really vile stench over on Elm and they figure it's comin' from Skip's place. And no one wants to say anything, I mean, what do you do, go knock on the guys door, "Hi, you're house stinks"? So - so people are trying to ignore it, right? They're trying to pretend it - it isn't happening. A-and you know those pine things? They're trying to cover up with those pine things that you can put in cars. People are hanging those on their porches.
[Ricky laughs]
Oh, you think that's funny, Rick?
Well, yeah.

Well yeah - let me tell you what happened next, OK. The state health inspector shows up. They go over, they talk to Skip, he says he's got a sump pump problem. They leave. Hey, they guy's got a sewer problem, he says he'll look after it, everything's okay, right?
Right.
Wrong. A couple hours later there's smoke pouring out of the windows of Skip's house. The firemen show up, they go into Skip's house. Ya know what they find?
What?

Skip's family, dead. Murdered... by Skip... weeks earlier... with an ice pick. Yeah, the guy killed his own family with an ice pick. Yeah... yeah just put 'em in the cool basement, covered 'em up with a sheet and went back to makin' ice cream treats for the townsfolk. Only thing... Skip didn't count on there being a big heat wave that summer. You know what that was that all those people were smelling over on Elm, Ricky?
What?
Skip's family's bodies, decomposing in the summer heat
[Ricky whistles]
. Yeah apparently, one day Skip made just made one too many lemon phosphates,
[snaps fingers]
El snappo!
Green sky at morning, neighbor take warning.
Green sky at night?
Neighbor take flight?
I've never seen that. I've never seen anybody drive their garbage down to the street and bang the hell out of it with a stick. I-I've never seen that.
Nobody knocks off an old man in my neighborhood and gets away with it.

[Pounds]
Good solid walls...
[Pounds]
Good solid floors.
[Someone in the basement pounds in response. Rumsfield grins]
Oh-ho. Got somebody tied up in the ol' cellar, have yah, Rube?
He can't come out until he resembles the man that I married.
Carol, We don't have that kind of time.
[looking at photo]
Oh, pretty girl! Friend of yours?
No, it came with the frame.

[mocking]
It came wit de frame?

[finds a femur]
Ray, there's no doubt anymore. This is real. Your neighbors are murdering people. They're chopping them up. They're burying them in their backyard. Ray... This is Walter.
[They both scream]

Go ahead, tell him, Ray. We got the goods on them, don't we? You know, some day they're going to dig up the back of that yard and they're gonna find the rest of that skeleton to go with that femur. Oh it might not be Walter but it's gonna be some...
Shut up. SHUT UP, ART, SHUT UP! God, you don't know when to quit, do you? Look at me! I'm a shell of a man because of you, Art!
[last lines]
God I love this street.
Now they know that we know that they know that we know.
Safety is my middle name.
I thought his middle name was Louis.

I think the message to, uh, psychos, fanatics, murderers, nutcases all over the world is, uh, "do not mess with suburbanites". Because, uh, frankly we're just not gonna take it any more. Ya know, we're not gonna be content to look after our lawns and wax our cars, paint out houses. We're out to get them, Don, we are out to get them.
Smells like they're cooking a goddamn cat over there.
Wait, hold it, garbies! Garbies, garbage men! Hold on a minute, wait a sec! Wait. Wait, wait, hold it. What are you doing?
Emptying garbage.
Into the garbage truck? What are you, out of your mind?
Mind your own business! MIND YOUR OWN BUSINESS!
OKAY!
There go the Goddamn brownies!
Hey, hey, hey. Who the heck ordered the blood shake? Hey, Ray, it's not Skip. It's me, Art. I'm just pretending to be Skip. Say, you didn't happen to see an ice pick around here, did you?
In Southeast Asia we'd call this kind of thing bad karma.
Art!
Your wife is home!
And your house is on fire!
My wife is home?
Here you go, sonny - a little something for the old sweet tooth.
I'm gonna go do something productive. I'm gonna go watch television.
Rumsfield's the name. Don't think I caught yours, sonny?
H-H-Hans.
Hans! Oh-ho! A fine Christian name. Hans Christian Andersen! What are you, Catholic?
What have you got in the cellar, HERR Klopek!
I hate cul-de-sacs. There's only one way out, and the people are kind of weird.
Hey... Pinocchio! Where are you going?
[runs away and slips on dog poop]

[runs, slips and falls on poop too; then grabs him]
Don't you make a move sonny. I was eighteen months in the bush and I could snap your neck in a heartbeat.
Ricky, get this lame-o out of your yard.

[puts his arm around his friend]
Get out of my yard, Lame-o!

I know you're in there, old man! Listen up, mister! That piece of scum barking rat of yours has just taken his last dump on my lawn! I find one more- just one- I'm gonna catch him and staple his ass shut!
Apparently their last house, it only... burned to the ground.
Really?
Yeah, a hideous raging inferno.
I'm tellin' ya, officer, there's a body buried in that house.
The old man, Mr. Seznick right?
Yeah the old guy who's sitting here is buried in that house, Sherlock.
Is that a transformer or something...?
It's the goddamn power company.
That really burns my ass.
What?
That old fart. He's got the best lawn on the block. And you know why? Because he trains his dog to crap in my yard.
Infra-red night vision scopes? What are we going to do next, tap their phones line?
That can be arranged.
I've been blown up, take me to the hospital.
[Lies on a gurney]
Take me to a hospital, I'm sick. What...?
[Jumps up, throws the gurney in back of an ambulance than jumps on top of it]
Honey? I'll just find out what hospital they're taking you to and then I'll... Follow right along. Okay?

[Lying face down on the gurney]
Okay, honey.
Affirmative. That garbage is going nowhere. I say we wait till first light. Scope me.
The question here is garbage. Who picks up this mess?
Who picks up this mess? Well you're going to pick up the mess, because YOU are a garbage man.
I pick up garbage from cans, not from the street!
You wanna take that out of your pocket? You wanna not steal that from Walter's house, please?
You had a dream a plane was gonna crash, so you took the bus to Las Vegas.
If I had been on the plane it WOULD have crashed.

I'm telling you these people are Satanists. As I sit here, they are satanists. Look, look, the world is full of these kind of things - black masses, mutilations. Mutilations! The incubus, the succubus - I'm tellin' you, Walter was a human sacrifice.
Ray, do you want 'em to take your family, kidnap 'em, tear their livers out and make some kind of satanic pâté?
[Art and Ricky are sitting on the porch when Ray comes out]
He comes over here to smoke cigars, his wife won't let him, he doesnt know i know that... Hiya Ray! How ya doing bud?
Where are you going?
I can't walk anywhere without you asking me where I'm going - I'm going to Paris, France, okay? I'm going to Banff, Canada, alright? That's where I'm going.
Are you taking the dog?
Yeah, yeah, I'm taking the dog for a walk.
No, Art, see, they're gonna think that I did it. Yeah, they are...
Why?
Well the old guy... He saw me write a note and put it underneath Walter's door SO NOW THEY'RE GONNA THINK THAT I DID IT!
...You wrote a note?

[Ray is trying to jimmy the door open with a store credit card]
Where did you learn to do that?
I *don't* know how to do this.
[the credit card breaks]
That's a shit store anyway.
Sardine?
I'm trying to cut back.
I don't know if you've noticed, but there's bars on the basement windows here.
They've got holes in their porch, too.
Argh! That was a booby trap.
Are you okay?
Yeah.
Oh, booby trap. I'm not gonna pay for that.
We shouldn't pay for that, we should sue them.
A thermostat on a home furnace; is that supposed to go to 5,000 degrees, you think?

[Ray takes Walter's toupee out of his shorts]
Are you implying that you've been carrying that around in your shorts all day?
After you left Walter's house yesterday, I slipped this back in, through the mail slot.
Well, where'd you get this then?
[Ray gestures to the Klopeck's house]
After the dog came up out of the basement, I found it wedged in between a bunch of magazines all of which I might add, were addressed to Walter!
Then that means that...
Klopeck went back into the house and got the hair. What do we do now, soldier?
Well you heard them say they're leaving tomorrow morning? As soon as they're gone, I'm going over that fence, and I'm not coming back until I find a dead body.
So they keep to themselves, can you blame them? They live next door to people who break in their house, AND BURN IT DOWN while they're gone for the day!
[loud gunshots are heard]
Art's got a gun
You were up at the crack of dawn watching a dog poop.
Hey, Mrs. Rumsfield, no tan lines. Looks nice.
That kid next door's a meatball.
Are you totally pussy-whipped, or what? Why don't you just take your balls out of your wifes purse... make a stand for one time in your life.
Ya know, did you ever see the movie "The Sentinel," Mr Peterson? It's about the old guy who owns the apartment which is kinda like the, uh, gateway to hell.
No, I, I didn't see that.
Well, I was doin' some thinkin' and you know, being that their last house burned down and all, it's like maybe, somebody left the gate open.
Do I look like an idiot, Mr. Peterson?
Do you take me for an imbecile?
You may have fooled the others, Mr. Peterson, but you don't fool me.
I-I-I-I fooled the others?
But you don't fool me.
I don't?
No you don't.
Am I missing something here, Dr. Klopek?
Come now, Mr. Peterson, you were in my basement. Surely, you looked in the furnace.
Well I-I-I-I saw your furnace, Doctor. I figured a man's furnace is his own business.

You saw one of my skulls, didn't you? Oh yes, I know you did. It belonged to a neighbor of yours. The name was Knapp. We took the house from them. I offered to buy it, but you know how old people are, they grow so attached to things.
Uh, you know, Dr. Klopek, I think I forgot my wallet...
[Tries to get up but is held down]
I let you keep the femur, but now, now I want my skull. Or perhaps, I might just take yours. Hans!
What'd you say we all sit down for a little of the old face-to-face, hey What-Rube?
Hey man, when's the big unveiling, huh? Look, i gotta go to work in a couple of hours, you know.
Hey man, piss off.
Mr. Rumsfield. You guys managed to knock out the power on the entire block. Probably the whole south end of town.
Ricky, SHUT UP.
I can see the news report now - they were a quiet family, kept pretty much to themselves. No one would have ever suspected them of foul play.
It's Walter's Toupée.
Oh jeez, beautiful place to keep a toupée, on the stove. I'm starving.
[walks off to the fridge]
One thing about these old guys - they don't ever leave the house without their hair. No sir. Walter left this house in a big hurry.

[mumbling]
aw, oh I should have gone to the lake, I shoulda listened to Carol...
Listen to your wife? Who listens to their wife? Listen, you gotta listen to me.
Ray. Ray.
I'm only trying to take a nap! I'm only laying here with my eyes closed trying to keep some goddamn sleep!
Rumsfield and I, we flushed them out. We wrote a note, we slipped it under the door, we rang the bell and then we ran.
You did that?
Yeah.

[Jumps up]
OH GEEZ! STUPID IDI - I can't believe you -...
[Crushes a beer can in each hand]
All I did was write, "I know what you've done". That's all. I didn't sign it.
OH! I can't belie - YOU STUPID... GOD!
You gotta goose these people every once in a while. You gotta give them a little shot, give them a little whack, let them know that you're there.
Ray... Ray, where are you going? Come back to bed.
[Ray heads outside]
We caught ya, Reub. You think you've been playing us for saps but you were wrong.
Ray, there's nothing in here- we practically checked this whole truck. They-they must have switched on us during the night.
The FBI?
Oh, Mr. Rumsfield, be careful! Queenie...

[steps in poop]
Goddamn it!
Uh-oh.
Walter. Walter! Walter!
I love that dude.

[emptying the Klopeks garbage into the street]
Give me that.
Here you go.
[empties bag in street]
What are YOU doin'?
You asked me to help.
[groans in annoyance]
You know what the deal is? We gotta go down to the religious supply store. We gotta get a couple of gallons of holy water. My cousin Gary is a priest. He can get us a deal!

[chanting]
I want to kill everyone. Satan is good, Satan is our pal.
Shut up and paint your GODDAMN HOUSE!
Let's cut this "nice" crap. We know what's goin' on here. What's the weird Goddamn noise comin' from the basement?
I'm a broken man because of you, Art!
